html:
4.9.23  7:51 pm   If I had a chord progression that was essentially a vamp between Cm9 and Bmaj7/Db, would it make sense to go to F#maj7 after that and do somthing like u did in "when I get older" where you go between F#maj7 and Abmaj7add6 ?

     Or would you in this situation instead move into a new key using Gmaj7/A as a stepping stone, kinda like the harmonic movement in the "Stay for a while" bit in "if the world doesn't end". This movement would open up the possibility to modulate to D but idk enough music theory to go somewhere other than that with the suspended voicing of A major which is Gmaj7/A

4.8.23  7:54 pm   I've been learning guitar messily on and off but I really haven't made much progress. I wanna advance but I can't see any clear path forward and I don't know what to do or where to go, I'm watching friends of mine get better and I want to be like them but don't know how. I know some chords pretty decently, I don't know what to practice or just at all how to progress. Can you help me please? I don't know how to go forward.

The names of course are similar, but the themes are also really similar and they even have an almost identical line at the end. Did you mean to have corner store be a kind of successor to airport terminal

     or did you just have similar inspiration for both?
